TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national , who was born in DATE and lives in GPE , GPE .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows :
In DATE the applicant ’s property in ORG was expropriated . In DATE the applicant and CARDINAL of his brothers lodged an application for restitution of that land with LOC ( PERSON ) .

The Poznań Mayor ( Prezydent Miasta ) failed to issue a decision . On DATE the case - file was transferred to ORG ( FAC ) , as under the new legislation it had become competent to deal with the applicant ’s case .

On DATE the applicant lodged a complaint with ORG alleging inactivity on the part of the first - instance administrative authority . On DATE the court gave a judgment and ordered ORG to deliver a decision within a time - limit of DATE .

Meanwhile , on DATE ORG issued a partial decision and determined that CARDINAL of the expropriated plots of land had ceased to serve the purpose indicated in the expropriation decision . On DATE the Governor of ORG quashed this decision and remitted the case for re - examination .
On DATE ORG held the so - called “ administrative hearing ” ( rozprawa administracyjna ) . On DATE an expert submitted his report .

On DATE the ORG issued a decision to the effect that part of the property be returned to the applicant and other co - owners . It also ordered that they pay the indexed sum to ORG in return for the compensation , which they had received in DATE .
On DATE , upon an appeal lodged by the applicant ’s brother , the ORG Governor quashed the first - instance decision and remitted the case
On DATE ORG ordered that a plan concerning the partition of the property be drawn .
On DATE ORG decided that expert evidence be obtained in order to determine the value of the property . On DATE the expert submitted her report .
In the course of the proceedings , the applicant ’s father died . On DATE the ORG declared that his property was inherited by one of the applicant ’s brothers and his children .
On DATE ORG held an administrative hearing .
In DATE ORG ordered that yet another expert report be obtained . On DATE the expert submitted his report .
On DATE and DATE ORG asked the relevant authorities for information about the infrastructure of the street situated along the property in question .
On DATE the Law of DATE on ORG ( Ustawa o gospodarce nieruchomościami ) came into force . On DATE the ORG Governor became competent to deal with the applicant ’s case .
On DATE an administrative hearing was held .
On DATE the authorities informed the applicant that a new time - limit for the issue of a decision determining the case was set for DATE .
On DATE the ORG Governor informed the applicant that he could consult the expert report concerning the value of the property ( operat szacunkowy ) .
On DATE the ORG held an administrative hearing .
On DATE the expert report was amended .

On DATE the ORG issued a decision ordering that a certain part of the property be returned to the applicant and other co - owners , as it had no longer served the purpose specified in the expropriation decision . The FAC Governor ordered the co - owners to pay the indexed sum to ORG in return for the compensation awarded to them in DATE .
On CARDINAL and CARDINAL DATE respectively , the applicant ’s brother and the respondent company appealed against that decision to the President of ORG ( Prezes PERSON i PERSON ) .
On DATE the President of ORG upheld the decision of the ORG .
It appears that on a further appeal the case is pending before ORG .

LAW lays down time - limits ranging from DATE to DATE for dealing with a case pending before an administrative authority . If those time - limits have not been complied with , the authority must , under LAW , inform the parties of that fact , explain the reasons for the delay and fix a new time - limit . Pursuant to LAW , if the case has not been dealt with within the time - limits referred to in ORG and DATE , a party to administrative proceedings may lodge an appeal to the higher authority , alleging inactivity . In cases where the allegations of inactivity are well - founded , the higher authority fixes a new term for examining the case and orders an inquiry in order to determine the reasons for the inactivity and to identify the persons responsible for the delay . If need be , the authority may order that measures be applied to prevent such delays in the future .
Until DATE , under LAW , a party to administrative proceedings could , at any time , lodge a complaint with ORG about the fact that an administrative authority had failed to issue a decision .
On DATE , when a new LAW DATE on ORG ( “ the DATE LAW ) took effect , LAW was repealed .
Under LAW , a party to administrative proceedings may , at any time , lodge a complaint with ORG about inactivity on the part of an authority obliged to issue an administrative decision .
Section CARDINAL of the PERSON provides :

“ When a complaint alleging inactivity on the part of an administrative authority is well - founded , ORG shall oblige that authority to issue a decision , or to perform a specific act , or to confirm , declare , or recognise a right or obligation provided for by the law . ”

Pursuant to LAW , the decision of ORG ordering an authority to put an end to its inactivity is legally binding on the authority concerned . If the authority has not complied with the decision , the court may , under section CARDINAL of the DATE Act , impose a fine on it and may itself give a ruling on the right or obligation in question .
